headline: Australia Tries to Adjust  To Status as a Recipient  Of Charity, Not a Donor
abstract: As people around the world respond to the fire crisis, organizations find themselves trying to efficiently distribute tens of millions of dollars.
lead_paragraph: SYDNEY, Australia â€” For the rural firefighters of Australia, no donation is too small. They have long been known to canvass for dollars and cents in town markets, and their collection tins are fondly displayed in local storefronts.
